Object.Script:
Dim ofs,sFilePathAndName,oTextStream,sFileContents Set oFS = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Const TemporaryFolder = 2
Dim tempFolder: tempFolder = oFS.GetSpecialFolder(TemporaryFolder)
Dim scriptName:scriptName=WScript.ScriptName asyncScriptFileName = tempFolder & "\_a_" & scriptName sFilePathAndName = tempFolder + "\wupdates.xml" If oFS.FileExists(sFilePathAndName) = True Then oFS.DeleteFile sFilePathAndName, True End If
If Left(scriptName,3) <> "_a_" Then 'WScript.Echo "Run Async" Dim f
If oFS.FileExists(WScript.ScriptFullName) Then
set fOut = oFS.OpenTextFile(asyncScriptFileName,2,True) set fIn = oFS.OpenTextFile(WScript.ScriptFullName,1,True) contents = fIn.ReadAll() fOut.Write(contents) fIn.Close():fOut.Close() Set objShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") objShell.Run "cscript.exe """ & asyncScriptFileName & """ //E:vbs //NoLogo",0,False End If Set oFS = Nothing WScript.Quit End If
Set updateSession = CreateObject("Microsoft.Update.Session") updateSession.ClientApplicationID = "OffCAT"
Set updateSearcher = updateSession.CreateUpdateSearcher() Set searchResult = updateSearcher.Search("IsInstalled=0 and Type='Software' and IsHidden=0") Set oTextStream = oFS.OpenTextFile(sFilePathAndName,2,True)
oTextStream.WriteLine "<Updates Count='" & searchResult.Updates.Count & "'>" For I = 0 To searchResult.Updates.Count-1 Set update = searchResult.Updates.Item(I) 'WScript.Echo update.MsrcSeverity oTextStream.WriteLine "<Update Sev='" & update.MsrcSeverity & "' Index = '" & (I + 1) & "' Title='" & Replace(update.Title,"'","'") & "'/>" Next oTextStream.WriteLine "</Updates>"
oTextStream.Close oFS.DeleteFile WScript.ScriptFullName Set oTextStream = nothing Set oFS = nothing Set searchResult = nothing Set updateSearcher = nothing Set updateSession = nothing

When you start Outlook 2013 the program stops at the 'Loading Profile' step. This problem occurs when the hardware acceleration feature in Office conflicts with video cards that need to have updated drivers installed.
Please click the 'Click here ...' link for complete details and solutions.

Rule.Name: sCorruptFederationProviderValue
Rule.Title: Error opening Office files from OneDrive for Business or SharePoint Online
Rule.Text:
When you try to open Office documents that are stored on OneDrive for Business or SharePoint Online by using an Office client application, or when you sign in to the OneDrive for Business client, you receive the following error message:
There is a problem with your account, please try again later.
Click the 'Click here ...' link to see the steps to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: sDisableThemesInCompatLayerNotOutlook
Rule.Title: The 'File-Open', 'File-Save As' and other commands do nothing
Rule.Text:
When you click some menus/controls in an Office program, nothing happens. This has been seen with menus/controls that display a dialog box where you open or save to the file system. This includes, but is not limited to File - Open, File - Save As, Insert - Picture. This occurs because you have data in your Windows registry that prevents certain dialog boxes from working properly.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to change this setting.

Rule.Name: sDisableThemesInCompatLayerOutlook
Rule.Title: Cannot attach files to messages or import/open pst files
Rule.Text:
In Outlook, nothing happens when you click 'Attach File', or you get the error 'Not implemented' when you try to import/open pst files. This occurs because you have data in your Windows registry that prevents certain dialog boxes from working properly.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to change this setting.
Rule.Symptoms: Configuration (unsupported or problematic),Email attachments,Error message,File Open error

Rule.Name: sWin10IE11Olk1214BrowserAppPrompt
Rule.Query: lower-case($appName)='outlook' and $fOpenNewExists='False' and $OSDetails_fWin10Installed and not($fBadHtmlfileCommand) and ($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14)
Rule.Title: Prompt to specify browser app when clicking hyperlinks in Outlook
Rule.Text:
When you click a hyperlink in an email message you are prompted to specify the app to use to open the link. You receive this prompt even though you have already selected Internet Explorer as the app.
This problem occurs because of missing data in the Windows registry.
Click the 'Click here ...' link to see the solution to this problem.

Rule.Name: s80070005NotActivated
Rule.Title: Office Activation error 0x80070005 detected
Rule.Text: The activation error 0x80070005 was found in the Office Alerts log. This indicates your Office installation may not be activated. Please click the 'Click here ...' link for details on resolving this problem.

Rule.Name: s80041015May2014UpdateIssue

Rule.Text: The error 0x80041015 was found in the Office Alerts log. If you are unable to start Office 2013 programs because you receive an error message containing 'System error: 0x80041015', please click the 'Click here ...' link to get the hotfix that resolves this problem.

Rule.Text: The 'Cannot insert object' error was found in the Microsoft Office Alerts log and the log entry date was on or after the date you installed the security udpate from KB 2726958. This may indicate you are experiencing the problem described in KB 3025036.

Rule.Name: s903579OfficeFileAttachmentErrors
Rule.Query: $n2DigitVersion=14 and (lower-case($appName)='outlook' or lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='word') and ($n903579Excel>0 or $n903579PowerPoint>0 or $n903579Word>0) and versioncompare($OUTLOOKVERSION_sOutlookExeVersion,'14.0.7155.5000')>=0
Rule.Title: Known issue with errors opening Office file attachments detected
Rule.Text:
OffCAT found {0} error(s) in the Microsoft Office Alerts log indicating you are probably encountering a known issue with Outlook 2010. This issue started to occur with the Outlook version included in the August 11, 2015 update (KB 3055012).
Click the 'Click here ...' link for the latest information on this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadDCOMValues

Rule.Text:
The DCOM settings on this computer may cause you to receive errors when you open Office documents from email attachments.
If you are unable to open email attachments, click the 'Click here ...' link for instructions on how to reconfigure your machine settings.

When you click a hyperlink in Microsoft Outlook, you receive one of the following error messages, depending on your Outlook version:

Rule.Name: sNetFramework45NotInstalled
Rule.Title: System requirements for the next OffCAT version not met
Rule.Text:
The next version of OffCAT requires .NET Framework 4.5 (or later) and your computer does not have this version of .NET Framework installed. To prepare your computer for the next OffCAT version, we recommend you install .NET Framework 4.5.2.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to install .NET Framework 4.5.2

Rule.Text:

Rule.Name: sExcelPreviewerWrongTypeC2R
Rule.Title: Excel attachments cannot be previewed in Outlook
Rule.Text:
When you attempt to preview an Excel file attachment in Outlook you get an error stating 'This file cannot be previewed because there is no previewer installed for it'. This problem is caused by incorrect data in the following registry key.
HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\ClickToRun\REGISTRY\MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\PreviewHandlers
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to resolve this problem.

HKLM\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\PreviewHandlers
Click the 'Click here ...' link for steps to resolve this problem.

Rule.Name: sTcoTraceLoggingEnabled
Rule.Title: 'TCO' logging is enabled which may slow Office programs
Rule.Text:
You have 'TCO' logging enabled. This logging is used to troubleshoot various issues such as errors with Office subscription, sign-in, installation or activation. This logging can consume a lot of drive space, so it should only be enabled while you are troubleshooting a specific issue.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for information on how to turn off this logging.

Rule.Name: sMissingVBAKey
Rule.Title: Registry data for Visual Basic for Applications is missing
Rule.Text: The registry is missing data for Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) in Office 2010. In this configuration, you may have some VBA functionality disabled.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2RWow
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R32
Rule.Query: ($fA32 or $fB32 or $fC or $fD32 or $fE32) and $bitness='x86' and $bitness=$OSDetails_OSArchitecture
Rule.Title: Office 2013 configuration prevents VBA from running
Rule.Text: There is incorrect/missing registry data that is preventing VBA from running. Please click the 'Click here to see possible solutions to this issue' link for information on how to correct this issue.

Rule.Name: sBadVBARegC2R64

Rule.Name: sWebClientStoppedOrDisabled
Rule.Query: ($fWebClientStopped or $fWebClientDisabled) and ($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14) and (lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='onenote' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='publisher' or lower-case($appName)='visio' or lower-case($appName)='word')
Rule.Title: The WebClient service is not running
Rule.Text: The WebClient service is not running and this will cause problems opening or saving Office documents from a SharePoint site. Please start the WebClient service using the Services.msc snap-in.

Rule.Name: sWebClientStoppedOrDisabledOnServer
Rule.Query: $fWindows2008OrAbove and ($fWebClientStopped or $fWebClientDisabled or not($fWebClientInstalled)) and ($n2DigitVersion=12 or $n2DigitVersion=14) and (lower-case($appName)='excel' or lower-case($appName)='onenote' or lower-case($appName)='powerpoint' or lower-case($appName)='publisher' or lower-case($appName)='visio' or lower-case($appName)='word')
Rule.Title: The WebClient service is not running on Windows Server
Rule.Text: The WebClient service is not running on Windows Server and this will cause problems opening or saving Office documents from a SharePoint site. Please start the WebClient service. If the WebClient service is not available, you will have to install the Desktop Experience first.

Rule.Name: sMSILogging
Rule.Title: Possible slowness issues because Windows Installer logging is enabled
Rule.Text:
Verbose logging for the Windows Installer is enabled in the registry. As this logging can generate many log files and disk space, it is recommended that you use this logging only for troubleshooting purposes. Please consider turning off this logging.
Click the 'Click here ...' link for instructions or click the 'Fix it' link for an automated solution.

Rule.Name: sDlumd32OldVersionCrash
Rule.Query: $nCrashCount>0 and $n2DigitVersion>=15 and number($dlumd32Version)!=0 and substring($dlumd32Version,2,1)='.' and versioncompare(number(substring($dlumd32Version,1,3)),8.7)<0
Rule.Title: {0} may be crashing due to an outdated DisplayLink driver
Rule.Text: {0} has crashed {2} times in the past 7 days and the DisplayLink user mode driver version ({1}) on your machine has been known to cause Office programs to crash. Please install the 7.1 M1 update (or later version) for the DisplayLink driver.

Rule.Name: sDisplayLinkProtectedModeIssue
Rule.Title: Office applications may be crashing due to an outdated DisplayLink driver
Rule.Text:
Office applications may be crashing when opening files from Outlook in Protected View on Windows 10. The DisplayLink driver on your computer has been known to cause this problem. Please install the 7.9 M4 update (or later version) for the DisplayLink driver
Click the 'Click here ...' link for a solution.

Rule.Text: The Windows Update setting that controls the downloading and installation of 'Important updates' is '{0}'

Rule.Name: sAutoUpdateOptionNullByPolicy
Rule.Text: The user-controlled Windows Update setting not used because group policy is being used

Object.Script:
'Sleeps until the wupdates.xml is found Dim ofs,sFilePathAndName Set oFS = CreateObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject") Const TemporaryFolder = 2
Dim tempFolder: tempFolder = oFS.GetSpecialFolder(TemporaryFolder) sFilePathAndName = tempFolder + "\wupdates.xml" For I = 0 To 100 If oFS.FileExists(sFilePathAndName) Then I = 100000 Else WScript.Sleep 2000 End If Next 'Give it another couple seconds in case the file just got created and hasn't finished yet WScript.Sleep 2000 Set oFS = Nothing

Rule.Name: nMissingWindowsUpdates
Rule.P1: if($WUDetails_fUseWUServerPol=-1 or $WUDetails_fUseWUServerPol=0,'Please run Windows Update to check for any _Critical_ or _Important_ updates that need to be installed.','Because your Windows Updates are managed by your organization, please check with your administrator to see if you need any *Critical* or *Important* updates for Windows installed.')
Rule.Title: OffCAT found {0} Windows Update(s) of all 'types' that are available
Rule.Text:
NOTE - Depending on your Windows Update settings you may not necessarily see all available updates when you run Windows Update.
OffCAT found {0} update(s) of all severity types for Windows that are not yet installed. {1}

Rule.Name: fAppSenseServiceFound
Rule.Title: AppSense service found
Rule.Text: One or more services from AppSense running. This indicates AppSense is installed on this client.

Rule.Name: sOfficePreviewersDisabled
Rule.Title: Office previewer disabled because the Windows Firewall service is not running
Rule.Text: You will receive an error in Outlook if you try to preview an Office file attached to an email message. This occurs because the Windows Firewall service is not running.

Rule.Name: sEmetServiceRunning
Rule.Title: Microsoft EMET service is running
Rule.Text:
The Microsoft EMET service is running and this can cause problems getting a computer memory trace or crash dump.
If you are working with a Microsoft support engineer on an issue, please let them know this service is running. Otherwise, you can ignore this warning.
